caption: Totally underwhelming.  Quality of food saved this from getting 1 Star ( except the cold soggy fries).  The staff was attentive at the wrong times, interrupting while the Matriarch  was being honored on her 80th birthday.  They seemed bothered by a request for more bread.  When it finally arrived, it was stale.  Additionally, we waited WAY too long for our dinner.  They sang happy birthday to the table of 3 next to ours but for our table of 11, not a peep.  But the most pathetic part of our family celebration was having to do so in a ridiculously cold temperature.  I called the front desk because our waiter was somewhere NOT by our table.   I was informed by the lady up front that she would let the manager know who came by our table and adjusted the temperature. He did not say anything to us. 20 minutes later I asked our waiter to get the manager to increase the heat. The manager came over and explained that it would take some time for the four thermostats to kick in. His attitude was pretty poor and if it were my restaurant I’d fire him.  In summary, the food is not good enough to warrant a return.  BTW.. still waiting on the check, which was asked for quite a while ago.  I received a response from the owner below, but Ill add it here just in case it happens to disappear...  Response from the owner 14 hours ago Mr Stamas,  First let me apologize for the experience you received on your last visit. We strive to reach the highest standards in food and service here at Charlie Palmer Steak. We would like the opportunity to speak with you directly.  Please reach out to the restaurant directly, if you care to discuss further. Thank you for your time. I hope to hear from you soon.  If YOU care, feel free to reach out to me.
This place knows how to satisfy their clients. Regularly with a very welcoming mindset. The food is reasonably priced, regularly yummy and clean.

I took my then girlfriend to Charlie Palmers for a delicious steak dinner and we ended up eating a four course meal...complete with a spectacular sommelier who provided us with our now favorite pinot noir and a phenominal dessert wine. This was such a fun experience for us and we just dove right into the menu and enjoyed working with the staff to get us all the best goodies they had available.  My girlfriend is now my fiancé! We will always look back on our experience at Charlie Palmers for its outstanding steak, delicious wine, and super fun staff.  Overall a spectacular restaraunt, which we both highly recommend for anyone looking to splurge and be treated to some of the best hospitality Washington DC has to offer!  We need to go back when its no longer 'temporarily closed'!!!!! 😏🤫💁‍♀️
Awesome and yummy food, I love the character this spot has, and the staff members were kind. I will definitely eat here again.
Great atmosphere and service. My steak wasn’t what I hoped for, but the people I dined with enjoyed their steaks a lot. Apps were delicious, too bad I didn’t have room for dessert
Service
Great venue with a very comfortable atmosphere and wonderful food but, it's overpriced. $66 for a very nice ribeye but anything else costs extra. Another $14  for a "twice baked" potato is crazy!
Always great

Worth it!! We went during restaurant week and it was so delicious. Definitely worth it to go again. This is a fancier and more expensive place and the food shows for it! The ambiance is also really nice and the experience was great. Can’t wait to come back!
Typical
I washere for a drink at the bar. The cocktail was excellent, the bartender was friendly, and the place is very nice.
Excellent.  My family really enjoyed this place.  thanks to everyone
A very lame offer of vegetarian dish _ quessadilla with no love at all prepared and a very ordinary salad _for ridiculously high prices has to perform far better
Large group, private room. Good food but did have to send back a steak undercooked. Dessert was yummy, dark chocolate and berries were good. Loved the sorbet.
Excellent food, attentive servers, great view of the capitol building.

Was not impressed with my experience at this restaurant. We were sat and not visited with a greeting until 10 minutes after sitting. We had ordered a Caesar salad that never made it to the table. When our order had come out, the filet was rare after asking for it medium. Server was unwilling to offer anything else, or another steak cooked to medium. Took off sides rather than the steak. Will not be returning.
Nice
Very nice atmosphere and great steaks
Excellent food. Great service. Nice atmosphere
Great lunch menu. The ceviche was perfect.
My favorite steakhouse in the DC area.  Excellent food and very friendly staff.  Makes every night feel like a special occasion.
The food was delicious. The service impressed. Very clean but also pricey.
Excellent food, service and the rooftop view is a must see
The food and service was great.

Perfection in all areas from servers all the way up to management. The management team went above and beyond to insure that ALL patrons were well taken care of. BEAUTIFUL restaurant that is set up nicely and is very comfortable. Very clean in all areas. Last but certainly not least ,the food was delicious and presentation was like a masterpiece. I will be back often and I highly recommend.
Exquisite 🥰
An upscale place with decent food,but not stellar. Typically a good lunch place near the Capitol building.

Stopped in for a quick lunch before my flight and had the pleasure of meeting the bartender Alexus. She recommended the 3 course meal which was outstanding! The fajitas were great. So much food for such a great price. Between the service and the food I will for sure stop here on my next layover!

We loved this restaurant!! The service was outstanding and the food was even better. They treated us like royalty and offered to give us a tour of the roof top area. Amazing!!!! I cannot thank them enough for such a memorable experience!!!!
Exceptional service and menu. The seafood platter is extraordinary
Exceptional service. Discovered a new bourbon mixed drink, the 202.  Beef exceeded all expectations.  Asian stir fry vegetables was the suprise side dish winner. It was a party of 5.

NOT WORTH THE MONEY.  Not impressed with Charlie Palmer.  Went there for lunch and then dinner a few days later. Ordered Grappa after my meal and they gave me a version of limoncello when I said this is not grappa the server went and spoke with the sommelier and came back saying it is a type of flavored grappa. The waiter offered for the sommelier to come over and speak to this and I said I would love to hear this, please send him over.  The waiter left and after a few minutes he came back without the sommelier and showed me a picture on his phone of what the bartender and sommelier were trying to pawn off as grappa. Also ordered bananas foster instead got a chocolate ice cream desert.  Charlie Palmer. If you don’t have it just say so. Don’t try to lie to me to increase my bill.

Staff over the phone wasamazing very accommodating and helpful. Waiters were OK. Food was amazing steak was well seasoned twice baked potato was BOMB. Fries were seasoned to perfection. Probably will return.

Staff over the phone wasamazing very accommodating and helpful. Waiters were OK. Food was amazing steak was well seasoned twice baked potato was BOMB. Fries were seasoned to perfection. Probably will return.

On the evening of 12/21 I treated my wife to dinner at Charlie Palmer Steak in DC in celebration of her 30th birthday. In the beginning, she was asked if she would like to have her coat checked, and she agreed. We were then sat by an unpleasant hostess. I didn’t think much about other than I did make a comment to her rudeness to my wife. We enjoyed drinks, dinner, and dessert. Upon our departure, my wife attempted to get her coat back from the coat check. I had misplaced the ticket. When asking for her coat, she was told “NO! You cannot have your coat without your ticket. It’s our policy.” Meanwhile it’s December in DC with a high of 30 degrees for the evening and she was told she could not take her jacket home with her. She insisted on getting her coat and the same rude hostess from the beginning blocked the doors with both of her arms wide so she couldn’t get through. She then fought with her about how she cannot have her jacket without a managers approval. THANK GOD I found the ticket while the wait staff was searching on the floor. After spending $330 and told that my wife could not have my coat, I will not be going back to Charlie Palmer Steak. I felt like there should have been more class here but I was mistaken.
Love the filet and the staff
The food and service were above our expectations. I really liked the vibes of this spot. Wonderful restaurant to take the family out for dinner.

Went here during lunch and were seated right away; I'd made a reservation but didn't need one.  The atmosphere was good, the service was excellent, but the food was a little lower quality than I'd expect for the price.  My wife and I had the filet mignon, and it was cooked to order (rare), but both were very marbled.  One of the sauces served with them was a roulade that was literally poorly melted butter.  Dessert was good, but the baked Alaska had too much alcohol on it, such that I was actually worried about driving afterward.  Bottom line, this seems to be a good place to ha e a business meeting, as that seems to be what everyone else was doing.  But the fare is not worth the price in my experience.
DC classic, and deservedly so. Very classy place, top notch staff, beautiful interior. One of the few places in DC that checks all the boxes. Also, fantastic location for political staff.

I go to this superb restaurant every couple of days because I enjoy the good air that is part of this restaurant. The personel is awfuly cordial and professional. The service is extremely quick. Needless to say, the food they serve is exceptionaly good. I frequent many times and I was always satisfied. The payment is modest. I suggest this restaurant to to all.
Deliciously expensive!  Not 1 complaint.
Good place for corporate and group outings for a meal.
Loved the surf and turf!
Way over priced!!!!Food is okay but not worth the cost. Drinks are way overpriced!
Maybe not 5 star good but..location, service ,ambience all 5*
Amazing food and service
The "filet" is not a filet. It is a tenderloin with a bunch of fat on it. False advertising.
(Translated by Google) Good quality of food, good service and expensive.  (Original) Buena calidad de la comida, buenas atenciones y costoso.
Great lunch, and a great deal during DC Restaurant Week

Nice restaurant and one of the few restaurants in that area. Very good food, recommend steaks here. Service is great and the restaurant is very nice. Parking is on street and I think there is a garage in back but likely need to pay to park.
Wow...one of the best steaks I've ever had with a beautiful view of the Capitol.

Great location,  delicious food and awesome service.  I had the lunch menu,  fajitas were perfect. Ceviche was delicious,  bread and butter was melting in my mouth. Lastly the chocolate mousse was yum but a bit too rich for me. Portions were decent I couldn't finish it all.
The service was good and the atmosphere pretty but the food wasn't worthy of the price.
Charlie Palmer remains one of the best restaurants in DC. The food is phenomenal and the service is impeccable.
Had a great lunch here but it was pretty pricey. Though you do get 3 courses and generous entree.
The Steak was great
Nice place for a special occasion.
Old school in the best sense. Great meaty dishes strong cocktails relaxed but upmarket vibe.
Long list of food in the Menu many options
By far the BEST IN DC
Great steak and service

When you put steak in your name brand, offer a small menu, and price it high, then people expect perfection. People expect the steak to be cooked perfectly, receive it nice and warm, and get an exceptionally piece of meat. Unfortunately, this was not the case in our visit to Charlie Palmer Steak in DC. My medium cooked steak came as medium-rare. It was lukewarm as it was probably sitting in the kitchen for few minutes. And the quality of meat was not any better than any chain restaurants. The restaurant gets 3 starts for decoration (even though the men’s bathroom was not in a good shape) and one star for the food.
Great...I attended a social...food and staff was awesome
Delicious, elegant and courteous service.
(Translated by Google) Perfect steaks and delicious side dishes, top service and a cozy atmosphere ...  (Original) Perfekte Steaks und leckere Beilagen, Top Service und gemütliches Ambiente...
A nice place for a business lunch or dinner or a nice dinner for a special occasion. Food is expensive but very good. The service is very nice. The decor is very modern and pretty.
Food was really good. Was there for company event so choices were limited. Will go again for the full menu
Excellent service. Good food. A little pricey though. Great ambience.
Great place 2 have a date, menu is wonderful & the service amazing
Outstanding food and even better service! Had a blast with our server Gustavo!
I was there for a friend's birthday a few months ago and Lamar Lusk gave us exceptional service!!!  He was on point!  We had a wonderful evening and plan to go back again!

I’ve lived DC a long time but never had the pleasure of dining at Charlie Palmer Steak. Finally, this weekend I had the pleasure of coming in for dinner with my wife.  Located at 101 Constitution Avenue NW CPS has so much to offer in regards to steak, seafood, and wine.  Our waiter Gustavo did an amazing job helping us with our food and drink selections.  To start my wife and I started off with the spicy margarita and 202 cocktails along with the seafood platter. Incredible 👌🏻  Moving on for our main courses we got the filet with truffles and chimichurri sauce and the Ora king salmon. My wife said this is one of the best filets she’s ever had. Although I’m not a big salmon guy I decided to give it a try after I learned they only serve the top 1% of salmon here New Zealand. I am so glad I tried it. They cook it perfectly here! If salmon is your thing definitely get.  Next, we got a few more drinks. I tried The Sheldon and my wife got the Texas Mule. These two drinks were just as good as the first two drinks we tried.  By this point my wife was full, but I was told their desserts are amazing so I kept on eating haha. I got baked Alaska and the vanilla-scented cheesecake. Not too sweet, but so much flavor. I definitely both!  The restaurant itself is well maintained and beautiful. The running stream under the giant wine cooler was so cool!  Again, our waiter Gustavo did an amazing job. He brought our food out to us quickly and correctly and extremely helpful with the menu.  I believe there is a parking garage on the north side of the building for parking. However, I’m not sure how much is since we parked on 1st and C street NW and used ParkMobile instead. Charlie Palmer opens at 5 pm and you only have to pay to park until 6:30 pm on the weekends. It cost $3.90. A much cheaper option compared to parking in the parking garage I’d imagine.

Service was fantastic. I cannot stress this enough! Food was meh for the league of steakhouses they are in. Nothing was spectacular. Nothing was terrible. Meat cuts were good. Just seemed to be missing something.
Great

Gave then five stars because the rating does not go up to ten. Food was outstanding especially the scallops and steaks. Employees were nice enough to take us up to the roof for a beautiful view of the US Capitol and provided incredible desserts and coffee afterward. For visitors to Washington they treated us better than regulars, more like family. I cannot recommend them enough for a wonderful gourmet meal and off the chart service.
I usually get great service, but the bartenders were totally put out by us wanting to order a drink! Go somewhere else.
Food was delicious, we were treated like royalty and the restaurant is beautiful.
Ultra high end steak house with a great menu, wine and cocktail list.  View from the roof is one of the best views of the Capitol in the District.

I thought I was going to score high with this one but it turns out I didn’t.  My favourite rib-eyes have always been achieved at a high heat to give it the charred outside yet juicy inside.  I didn’t quite get that nice marble fat from the cut as I was hoping. It also felt like the grill temperature was too low and therefore moisture escaped and steak was a bit tough....twice because the first one was returned.  All is forgiven but I hate the feeling of wasting a decent steak to a poor chef.

It is ok.  I think this place is more about its location than the taste of the food.  Not that the food is bad but it wad not great either,  just ok.  The only thing that "wow'd" me about this place was its price - not in a good way.
We went during restaurant week. They had a good restaurant week menu.
Great food and wine

Exceptional dining experiences don't come too often.  Charlie Palmer Steak in Washington DC is one of those experiences.  I ordered the beef carpaccio entree and the ribeye (recommended by our waiter) for two with a glass of malbec.  It was absolutely delicious and just the meal experience I was hoping for.  Ambiance is beautiful with nice tall glass walls overlooking the park outside.
Walking distance to Hyatt. Nice function room for our large group.

Great place for date night. Understated elegance is how I would describe the dining area. If you're in a small party try to get a table near the large floor-to-ceiling windows.  To start cleaning we got an appetizer they were offering as a special - tempura squash bloom stuffed with ricotta and crab meat which was delicious. My girlfriend had the filet which was perfectly cooked - she also what are the red wine demi glaze on the side but the steak was so well prepared she didn't use it. I had the 25 oz prime rib which was delicious if a bit chewier than normal, but still quite tastey all the same. We finished the meal off with a banana split - two spoons.  We paired our steaks with a red cab recommended by the sommelier which was awesome.  The manager had a special treat for us and took us to a private rooftop terrace in the building and spent a good amount of time talking about all kinds of things, which we enjoyed and appreciated given the fact he had plenty of other guests to attend to.  We will definitely return for date night.
Nice finding, nice food
The hanging steak was great. Service was awesome!

The service seemed a little off for being a fine dining restaurant. Server never brought my tea. Seemed to be dismissed cause I didn't order a sauce with my steak. The filet was overcooked and not as tender as anticipated. The onion seemed with the steak was larger then the steak. The dessert was recommended and rightfully so. Overall I wasn't impressed by it for the price.
Great food and excellent service, good ambience, very high end.
Great food, great service, the pulpo a la Gallego is a must try. Steak was amazing.  Our Sommelier was amazing. Please stop by for dinner if you are in DC.  IG @msjazzypena
Lovely restaurant, great food and service!
Fantastic steaks and service even for a large group of 17. Incredibly accommodating and hospitable. Also has a very cool and modern interior.
Desserts were amazing but the steaks were overpriced for its quantity
(Translated by Google) Fantastic food, I recommend with a clear conscience  (Original) Fantastyczne jedzenie, polecam z czystym sumieniem

What a wonderful birthday celebration we had at Charlie Palmer's. We chose Charlie Palmer's so that we'd have a "nice" setting, an atmosphere that we could hear each other, as well as top notch food. Charlie Palmer did not disappoint. We had a wonderful table overlooking the Capital, food was outstanding, service was impeccable and attentive, and best of all we were able to talk and hear each other. The night was made complete when at the end of the evening the waiter asked if we wanted to see the view of DC from the roof top. Being visitors we jumped at the opportunity. We were escorted to the roof top deck and saw Washington in all its glory. It was the perfect end to the perfect evening. Thank you Charlie Palmer for making this birthday dinner over the top!

Very nice place for a quiet, professional lunch.  Attentive wait staff without being overbearing.  Well appointed decor. Excellent steak sandwich with caramelized onions.  Very filling without leaving you with a "stuffed" feeling.
Food is good,  service is excellent!
Spendy but good
Found a bottle of 1995 VIADER that was superb ...they still have 2 of 1997 VIADER  that should be ready
Lamar Lusk took amazing care of us!!!
Step out of the lobby and into this great steakhouse!

Great steak. Ordered steak for 2 and two appetizers. Waiter wanted us to have the "full experience", so he brought out two of his favorite sides, on the house. And charged me. Feels kind of intentional, as I'm assuming the waiter checks the bill before presenting it.  Edit: Called and talked to the manager, Mike, and explained what happened. He was super apologetic and credited back the two sides AND desert!
Great steak and service. Had the couple's ribeye perfect 👍🏽
Great food. Great view.
It was average not worth what we paid for
Amazing service Chef Mike, Phil, Justine and David! Thank you.
Ironically their steak is usually undercooked.

Stopped in for a last minute bite and a good glass of wine. The staff here is exceptional; made my night. Lamar had impressive suggestions to help me through the wine list and was quick to recommend crowd pleasing favorites as well as the regional highlights. Can’t wait to come back.
Didnt like alll the food
Elegant, charming service, very friendly staff.  Warm environment with spacious seating.
Great food & service, beautiful views.
Nice place.  Great service and Steaks!!!
Lamar made us the best drinks we’ve ever had! He is very attentive and professional. The food was amazing; the best atmosphere in the entire DC. Can’t wait to go back!
Great view and meal
username: sylvia ypiranga de souza dantas e rodriguez

caption: It's Okay. Nothing great. It always leaves me feeling underwhelmed.
This is a great opportunity to gather and enjoy great food
Lamar. What can I say. I asked for a special martini and he made me the most delicious one ever!  He’s my new favorite and I WILL be back!!!
Thanks for the best margaritas, Lamar!  Happy margarita day!!
Lamar makes the best  margarita’s!  Happy Margarita day!
Best steak I've had in the DC area.  Can't go wrong with the porterhouse.  Service is also fantastic.

Best apres work cocktails ever. Lamar was beyond accommodating. He gave us DC advice that was amazing, served fantastic craft cocktails, beer and wine and dazzled us with his hors d’oeuvres choices. Townies and DC natives alike will love this place. Not to miss!!!

My first time here. The Bar staff is amazing. Lamar made me two delicious cocktails. Top notch atmosphere and service. The whiskey sour and the gimlet were amazing. My friend enjoyed a wonderful Vanilla Bean Lemon Drop . Really great. Highly recommended! Simply Super.
Lamar & Lewis are amazing bartenders.  Must go see them when in town. Cocktails are on point and food was delicious.  Mike was so gracious and nice.  Great atmosphere to bring friends for cocktails!
Go to see politicians and big deals
Lamar’s wine choice was impeccable! Great service
The customer service was great, the food was fantastic.
Excellent service

When Jesus Christ comes back for the second coming, He’s going to stop here for a prime rib on Friday evening before anything else. With the excellent and personal service from Lamar and his Midas touch at the bar, accompanied by a Chef Mike’s magic in the kitchen — there is no other place to stop in DC besides this! Do yourself a favor and stop in here for delicious food and drinks, the friendliness you encounter is just a plus.

After attending a wine tasting hosted by Quintessa vineyards, we decided to stay and have dinner at the bar where we met Lamar the head bartender. The service was amazing. We had friendly conversation and he was very knowledgeable about the food and beverages. I highly recommend this bar. I will definitely be coming back.

I went for my birthday.  The porterhouse was delicious and the best side was a tie between brussel sprouts and the baked potato!  Wonderful service and a great place to celebrate a special occasion.  Our server Josh was wonderful and treated our party like royalty.
It was convenient, that's about it. Food was, meh. Service was, meh. Not impressed...
We had the best service from Lamar and Lewis. The drinks were on point and the food was prepared perfectly . I will definitely be back in the future.
Amazing experience, Lamar provided exceptional service and the best sazarach!!!

Head Bartender Lamar not only prepares amazing cocktails, but also delivers them with style and pleasant conversation. We appreciated his professional service. We are glad we dined at the bar and had the opportunity to enjoy the fantastic food and beverages.

An incredible experience from top to bottom! Lamar lusk, Michael Irving, Louis McKiisset, Chef Mike, and Wilfredo vela made my evening unforgettable! I will be back soon with many more coworkers and friends!
Always excellent; service, food, all wonderful!

I had an awesome experience here, services was the best part and that's saying a lot because this steak was by far one of most tasteful meals of my life. But Bobby our waiter was very friendly and attentive. Not only did he and the rest of the staff treat us great they kept our drinks filled and always seemed caring. I would definitely recommend this place.
Horrible service at the Bar.
Great bartender and the chef creates the most amazing dishes!

While on furlough Charlie Palmer Steak is offering Federal Gov't employees a Fried Buttermilk Chicken Sandwich.  It was more than I could have asked for. It was delicious! Superb staff! Beautiful restaurant!!! Thank you Charlie Parker for the lunch during this difficult time.
Thank You for the #furloughmeal
Over priced and did not live up to the hype.
this place is great. it is better if you go with Congress is iut of session because they are less busy then. food and service are 5 + stars.
Great service
Everything was great. Thanks Lamar for the awwsome cocktails.
Thanks Lamar
Great drink and service from Lamar. He was so knowledgeable and made great drink suggestions to pair with our dinner.
Great time. Really enjoyed the food, drinks,and service. Lamar is awesome.
Wonderful drinks
Love coming here to hang out with Lamar, Sage and Luis for Happy Hour. Such a fun time and great cocktails!
I had a wonderful time Lamar tequila cocktails were amazing I love my boss.
Back regularly, love Lamar, Luis, Mike and Mike..... food is amazing, drinks amazing, atmosphere amazing......
Came with my colleagues, Lamar is amazing. Will be back.

My girlfriend and I came in for dinner and received outstanding service by Lamar.  He is truly first class, customer service oriented all the way.  The general manager, Michael Irving & Lamar  made superb food recommendations we are definitely coming back.

Amazing Dinner. Great street view. Had our company's end of year holiday party. It was a blast, great space and amazing colors, lighting. Was good enough to fit a money machine. Will recommend anytime for gathering. The catering too was amazing.
Great food and service. I had the pleasure of A5 Waygu and the Tuna Carpaccio

Dinner at any of Charlie Palmer’s restaurants is always a treat. Tonight was as magical as the first time we visited Aureole. We enjoyed the prime platter appetizer; a real seafood lover’s treat. The filets were perfectly cooked and the sea bass and king salmon entrees were beautifully presented and as delicious as they looked. Being indecisive, we shared some desserts. Again, top marks for those presentations - The service was attentive without being intrusive. From the 89 year old grandmother to the 16 year old tourist, we were all duly impressed as well as thoroughly satisfied. Our thanks to everyone who worked so well to make our visit magical.

I had an amazing dinner there just about a week ago. I set at the bar and Lamar was my bartender absolutely awesome a true professional from the beginning to the end . I will continue to come there long as Lamar is around he is a true Star!!
Mike Irving and Lamar are great. Top notch service. Love this place.
Great atmosphere and delicious food!
Great food and service.
A lovely place to dine. The staff is superb among the best and the food is delicious!

My friend and I love coming here. We often sit at the bar even on holidays. Today was especially great because the Head Bartender Lamar made us very nice cocktails. He told us to try a special blend of a gin that was infused with source tip and candy cane with lemon juice and sparkling wine. Amazing! Thank you for always making our nights great!
Lamar and Lewis are the best bartenders in the US. If I could give 6 stars I would.
Great food great service
Beautiful venue and delicious food. Entire event went very smoothly! Highly recommend for your company party or wedding festivities!
Attended a beautiful wedding!! Great view of the city, and the food was amazing!!
went to a rehearsal dinner here and it was gorgeous. The food was delicious and the event was perfectly planned and executed!!!
The only reason this gets 4 stars is service.  Food was good.  It was very nice on the inside like comfortable and cozy.  Drinks were okay, not the best but they got the job done.
Great bartender Lamar. Great wine selection from Brandon. And bourbon!
Charlie Palmer Steak is a great place for a happy hour or an intimate dinner. GREAT service; chicken wings and scampi are a HIT. NOT the crab cakes though
I had a great time with the bar staff. Kevin and Wilfredo we're awesome.
My family has been coming here for years. Its always good to see a familiar face when we come here. Lamar is just as much a part of our family. Thank you for everything.
We enjoyed everything. Big thanks to Lamar for the great cocktails. We will be back soon.
Came in to celebrate my friend’s birthday. Great food, drinks, and service. The bar staff is phenomenal.

I have been coming to CP's for years. The food and service is outstanding. The Head Bartender Lamar is one if the best bartenders in DC. Keep up the good work. Will definitely reccomend this bar for a great time.
Thank you Lamar for a fantastic birthday celebration.  Love coming here will be back soon.
Lamar the bartender is amazing! He is very attentive and made our visit to Charlie Palmer enjoyable. I can’t wait to come back.
Food and Service was amazing. Love coming here when I’m on the Hill. Lamar is the best bartender in DC.
Lamar is amazing!
Lamar had very great service
Great steakhouse! Highly recommend.
Have been here several times but this time they seemed to be short staffed and the level of noise made it very difficult to carry on a conversation.
Definitely check this place out! The service is wonderful, the staff is great and the food and drinks will not disappoint. 5 star experience all around.

Lamar Lusk! Is the name you need to remember. He makes the best drinks at Charlie Palmer. We have been here a couple of times and his drinks are always consistent.  No matter how small or big your group is their is something for everyone.  Best Margarita's I have had in a while!
Great bar. Great drinks. Great food. Awesome bartenders. Lamar, Wilfredo, Jayme, Lewis, and Saige.
My friends and I come here every so often and we wish we could come more. The food and service is amazing. We all love to come visit  with Lamar. Great Job! Keep up the good work.
As always, I enjoyed my service here. Lamar is great!

The soup had coconut milk instead of cream and it was a disgusting taste, the  broccoli rabe was too spicy ,the steak was medium rare instead of medium well and for the dessert the cake was dry and the frosting too sweet .  If you really want good steak, seafood and side orders  go to wolf gangs steak house don't know if  Washington DC has it but New York City has it there are two locations 33 street and park Ave and the second one is at 250 west 41 street bt 7th and 8th Ave who ever the owner is of charle Palmer steak house needs to hire a new head chef
The best steak I ever had.
Sat at the bar had great drinks and the best steak ever
Food was excellent. Service was great.
Excellent food and service.  Well done from beginning to end.  Can't go wrong with bottomless wine pairings with the Cut of The Week special.

If there's a steak house above all other steak houses, I'd have to say it's this one: Charlie Palmer's, right at one side of our capital building here in DC. Sides are done to perfection. Meat delicious and as ordered. Service is attentive and courteous. Wide selection of beer but, I'm afraid, none on draft.  When in DC, at least one dinner here, a must.
Fabulous
Very good

Ah, the T-Bone was so tender, could be cut with a fork and huge, ended up take some home. Asparagus was delicious as well. Fresh bread made the night. Enjoy a bottle of wine along with great service, made our dinner perfect.
Great steak prepared exactly to order. Fabulous tuna tartare and a great wine list.
Good place
Thank you all for a wonderful evening.
Hanger Steak is amazing
Incredible food and service.
The service was slow and below average. The food was good, but not worthy of this price point.

We celebrated our 1st Wedding Anniversary here last night. From start to finish we were greeted and had a memorable experience. We received complimentary glasses of champagne and even the seafood platter as an appetizer. Our food was impeccable along with the staff. To top it off our server took us to the rooftop for photos and views of the capital. I absolutely loved and so happy we chose to dine here for our wedding Anniversary. Everyone knew it was our anniversary and we felt so special. Thank you to the staff of Charlie Palmer’s we are forever grateful!
I had such a wonderful evening at the bar with Lamar and Wilfredo. Drinks were excellent as well as their service.
Staff were professional. I was impressed of their selection of wines and the menu had quality food like A5 Wagnu.
Great steak sandwich. Service was a bit off but not bad. Just a little slow
The atmosphere was beyond doubt absolutely stunning, the fares were as expected and the staff was very knowledgeable and professional. Only bad thing was the valet parking.
I absolutely enjoyed my experience.
Very pricey but worth it.
Great steak. Had medium well Strip that was tender as butter. The salad and sides were all fantastic. Very clean and service was incredible. Highly recommend.
One word...delicious!
Awesome atmosphere and hospitality!!! Thank you to Lamar and Mike who took such great care of us! I’ll be back with more friends 😄 also the fries were addictive!

Very good service. Waiters were very attentive. Without asking we were seated next to the window. Nice ambience. Crab cakes were excellent. Asparagus were juicy and large and baked potatoes with bacon were delicious. However the lobster ravioli was disappointing. And only 8 pieces for $37. Next time I will have a steak instead!
Awesome restaurant. ..cappy parking

Having heard great things about this steakhouse, I visited for restaurant week. It was disappointing on almost every single level. The tablecloth was stained and the table itself was broken (the leaves kept falling and banging my knees). The bathroom was also sticky and dirty. Despite about five different servers visiting our table of four guests, they couldn't manage to bring drinks out until we were well past our first course. I had to ask several times over for the beer I ordered. Their meatballs were Chef Boy-R-Dee quality. I got a steak cooked "Pittsburgh Rare" style, which appeared to just be badly burnt on the outside and rare on the inside. Not sure why I thought something with "Pittsburgh" in the title would mean it might taste good, but it was recommended. They charge an extra $15 on top to order a steak at a steakhouse when you order off the restaurant week menu, which sort of defeats the purpose of the restaurant week price fixe menu. When the check finally came, it belonged to a different table. When our proper check came, the server promptly dropped one of my party members credit cards on the floor and walked away.  There are better steakhouses in the area that aren't nearly as pretentious and low quality. I'm not sure if my experience was poor because it's restaurant week, but it's worth saying this city-wide event isn't an opportunity to take advantage of rubes, it's a chance to promote your restaurant and get repeat visitors.

Great drinks, excellent food, and excellent service.  Loved the drink with the mezcal in it.  The lobster add-on was perfect, as was the lobster ravioli.  One interesting fact: When we reserved, they said we could have a window seat to celebrate our son's birthday.  When we confirmed, and when we arrived, they said the window seats were reserved for parties larger than ours (4), even though the restaurant was empty when we arrived (5pm) and nearly empty when we left.  Finally, two smaller parties (one of two, one of three) were seated at window seats during our visit.  Perhaps they are VIPs.
Iconic restaurant close to the Capital. Outstanding food and service, worth the visit

Excellent service, delicious food. Filet - perfect! Tuna tartare - excellent! Shrimp cocktail - good! Crab cakes - amazing! Sorbet/custard bites-so yummy! Grilled pineapple/strawberry cheesecake - heavenly. Green beans - very green beanie (How truly good or bad could they be?) Gnocchi- pass on this, boring, bland. The biggest disappointment was the lobster. It had some kind of breading in it. Yeesh! This was not on the description of the "Surf and Turf". Why would they do that? The lobster aside.... All in all it was a lovely experience but not perfect. The service was pretty darn perfect though.
(Translated by Google) Excellent address. The perfect meats. The high prices.  (Original) Excellente adresse. Les viandes parfaites. Les prix élevés.
The steak was amazing, one of the best steaks I had in DC. And the dessert was great too. Only knock on the place was the service, quite bad for a nice steakhouse.
Great place!
Excellent Food and Service
I ordered the Filet and it was delicious. Salad and dessert we're also very good. Extensive wine selection.

Party of 33.... private room, set menu and EXCELLENT SERVICE! The Chef was kind and spoke to our group. The meal was an entire turkey centered meal with excellent atmosphere and service. Would attend again
Very expressive, below average food, nice decor, good service very disappointing
This is one of my favorite place to have a nice chill evening . The atmosphere is amazing, love the food and the customer service  is excellent.Lamar Lusk the best Bartender!!!

We were celebrating our anniversary and Charlie Palmer's was recommended to us. We were given a lovely table near the window and were served champagne to celebrate.  Our server David P was very helpful and informative. The chef that night was Josh and everything that came out of the kitchen was amazing! We had the seafood tower that was a meal in itself and we shared the porterhouse for two. There was more than enough for the two of us and it was done perfectly. The sommelier, Brandon, helped us with a wine choice which was spot on. Our bartender, Lamar, made one of the best martini's we have ever had. On our way out he shared his secret to the perfect martini. They surprised us with a Baked Alaska for desert and a selection of sorbets. We would highly recommend Charlie Palmers's and next time we are in DC we will definitely visit again.
Awesome food and service! Everything you expect from a high end class steak house!
This was THE BEST EXPERIENCE EVER!!! All of the staff were truly amazing. We will be back!
Bring your Brinks truck.
It's so nice in there... high class to me

I had dinner there last night for the first time. I was disappointed. The service is exceptional however the food was average. For example, I ordered a medium rare steak and it came out medium well . Furthermore, all of the side dishes …
Awesome food and service.
Fabulous services and yummy steak.i only order a cup of wine and cowboy cut ribeye, no matter volume and quality is great, I like the elegant atmosphere as well.
(Translated by Google) good  (Original) 좋아요
Best steak on the planet, and the pastry chef is a genius.
Great food. Love dining here.

Very upscale, very nice, hence expensive. The food is very good, no matter what you order, it is a win. The roof is fantastic, always ask for access to the roof, if possible, the view of the Capitol and entire DC is very appealing.
Everyone in our group thought the food was excellent. The staff was wonderful!
Steak salad was really delicious as was the potato leek soup. Convenient to Union Station.

Went with my fiance a while back and the service was horrible. I really wasn't expecting the level of disrepect we recieved after waiting almost an hour for service only to have the wrong dishes brought out I mean it was the worst experience ever and I have several friends who also experienced the same. I wonder what we had in common 🤔🤔

I want to start off by saying that my husband and I went here 8 years ago to celebrate getting engaged. We had an amazing time so went back to celebrate our anniversary. I think the management must have changed because our recent visit was a terrible experience. We get there and a gentlemen comes to our tables with water and we order cocktails. He was actually super helpful and nice. He recommended the cocktail I got (which was delicious and why I am giving 2 stars instead of one). When he brings our drinks and we tell him we can order he lets us know that he isn’t actually our waiter. So we wait an additional 20 minutes for our waiter to even come. The restaurant is pretty empty so not sure why there was a wait. He isn’t super polite or personable but whatever, he takes our order. We ordered the special which was the tomohawk steak and we ordered it medium. It comes out 30 minutes later and is totally rare. The server never came back to check how it was cooked. The pan they served it in was really hot so we cooked the raw pieces in the pan to get them a bit more done. We have to flag down another waiter to get our check. I get home and got a survey asking about my experience and I answer honestly. They say that they will be calling me within a few days. It’s been 3 weeks and I haven’t gotten a call. So clearly it’s not something they care about. If you want to spend a lot of money on a nice dinner (and experience) do not go here!!!
Worst service ever!!!!  Started off great and after main course was served the waiter never returned. Expected excellent food and service. The food was good the service was terrible.
Best steak I had in a while and the deserts are out of this world.
Amaxing everything.
Great
(Translated by Google) subtlety  (Original) Finomsagok
A fantastic steakhouse with great service and great food.

The bartender was great, entertaining and personable, but I thought Capitol Grille around the corner edged them out on food, they were good don't get me wrong, just in the head to head. Also interior was very 80s, not sure if I was missing something and that's fresh again or just awkwardly dated?

This place has always been one of my favorites in downtown DC near the Capitol so I finally decided to give a review.  I usually like to eat in the bar area where they make exquisite craft cocktails and amazing small plates and snacks.  I always order the beef sliders since they make a great snack and this time we decided to try the wine country picnic which offers a nice selection of artisanal meats and cheeses.  Since we were there during the Cherry Blossom Festival we were also able to try their special cherry blossom cocktail and it was very refreshing and a great way to end the day after walking around the cherry trees.  Definitely check this place out, next time you're near the Capitol.

Definitely a beautiful restaurant and location with great food. The price is on the higher end but I felt that it was worth while for the venue. The staff were very professional and accommodating. Fun place to eat as many congressman and others frequent the location!
Excellent food, of course. Superb service as you'd expect. Oysters are delicious and varied.
An outstanding experience. Executive Chef Mike Ellis leads his team in creating culinary masterwork. The ambiance is wonderful, the service is supurb.
Can you say "off the chain?" Wonderful and attentive service, awesome food and adult beverages. I cannot say enough.  Charlie Palmer is a must wgen in D.C.
Food was.  Awesome
Perfect steak every time.  Great service.

Way over priced. Atmosphere is nice, although the views of the capitol building aren't as good as other reviews suggest. Service is great, food is ok. Maybe my pallette is not refined enough to appreciate it, I've had way better meals at longhorn steakhouse for considerably less money.
Superb place and wonderful view of the capital.

Phenomenal! I have never been waited on by a more attentive and pleasant staff. I was not disappointed by a single item we ordered. Seafood was fresh, salad looked and tasted amazing, and the lobster bisque tasted like autumn. My only regret was trying the popcorn ice cream - I'll be thinking about how perfect it was until I go again! Mr. Palmer was truly gracious to my party and we are so grateful to him for making our entire trip to DC one to remember. Already looking forward to our next visit!

An absolutely unique and exquisite culinary experience, Charlie Palmer Steak is a must when visiting Washington D.C.. The staff was friendly, courteous and attentive to our dining needs. At one point in the evening, I attempted to see if I could empty my glass before the staff could re-fill it. I was unsuccessful. The waiter's recommendations for our starters and main courses were outstanding, but he could have recommended anything on the menu and it would have been delicious. Being in a steak house, I ordered the Cowboy Cut Ribeye. This may have been the best decision of my life(apologies to my wife) as this was the most delicious steak I've ever had the pleasure of eating. The atmosphere and décor were eloquent as well as welcoming. If all that wasn't enough, we were seated in front of the glass side of the restaurant that has the most perfect view of the Capital Building in D.C..(breathtaking) Go to Charlie Palmer Steak, it'll be the best decision of your life.
The food was ok. I thought the veggies were better than the meat. It's a beautiful restaurant though.

As the restaurant scene in DC has evolved, Charlie Palmer has become less interesting to visit, but the food is still reliably good and you cannot beat the view of the capitol. Try the gnocchi as a side. It's pillowy and delicious. The corkage policy is amazing (no corkage on domestic bottles with varying limits depending on the night of the week), and there is no attitude from servers or sommeliers when you opt to take advantage and decline other beverages. All in all, a super solid choice.
Outstanding food and service!
Underwhelming for a high end steak house.
Love this place. Good bar and seats with an awesome view of the Capitol dome. Share a side because the steak is big and the sides are too!
Decent steak didnt set itself apart

(Translated by Google) Extraordinary attention. The noise of the horizontal source, a zen way to converse and taste. You can feel the power watching the capitol not on a poster.  (Original) Extraordinaria atencion. El ruido de la fuente horizontal, un modo zen de conversar y degustar. Se siente el poder viendo no enn afiche el capitolio.
I have never had a good meal at Charlie Palmer's
Service was great... atmosphere was lovely... food was average.
Expensive
Excellent food and staff. We loved every minute of our experience.
Great food and service.
Best view of the Capitol while eating a juicy steak. Light filled dining room which allows for a great space for lunch or dinner conversation.
Awesome
Classy restaurant. Delicious food, awesome view in DC, and food presentation is very pleasing to the eye. Restrooms did not feel as well maintained as the dining area on the day of my visit.
Very good meal! Sides are phenomenal. Service / drinks were a bit slow despite it being a slow night. Ambiance is amazing. Bathroom is a bit weird and fun and sexy.

Best Martini and Steak I've had in a long time. The service was excellent although the main waiter did not formally introduce himself. Awesome unobstructed view of the Capitol is an extra treat. Bathroom very pristine as expected.
Great place to take business associates
Great steak place with amazing service.  All sides seem pricey until you realize they're served family style (enough to share).
Classy, delicious. Great for business luncheons.
Awesome steak!
Awsome food but very pricey
Great food and ambience. Good quality service and food.

I had lunch earlier today (11-9-17) at Charlie Palmer Steakhouse. Very disappointing and the staff could care less. Do not get the lump crab cake sandwich. It is false advertisement because there is nothing lump about it. There was a lot of filler and it was too salty. I have seen better crab cakes at the grocery store.
I went there for a lunch presentation food was good though the vegetables were no longer warm by the time I was served. Nice chocolate dessert.
Service and dessert were absolutely perfect. The beef short ribs were very good, but not great.
Very Nice!
Great stakes and wine list
Amazing steaks. Everything excellent.
Food was excellent.  Small portions.  Vegetarian option was excellent.  Service great.  Private room was very noisy from loud conversations outside the room.
the best service and food ever. The chef, Mike, is a fab guy!
Amazing! Some of the best most delicious steaks I’ve ever had!
